item.title: Meta、微软用人工智能消费狂潮考验投资者的耐心
item.description: 最大的科技公司都在为人工智能的未来下注，因为巨大的数据中心群里装满了嗡嗡作响的服务器。【原文：The largest technology companies are betting on an AI future powered by gigantic complexes of data centers filled with humming servers.】

item.title: Groww 母公司 Billionbrains 在孟买 IPO 募集 7.52 亿美元资金
item.description: 印度最大的投资平台 Groww 的母公司 Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd. 表示，它正在寻求在孟买进行首次公开募股，以筹集多达 663 亿卢比（约合 7.52 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd., the parent of India’s largest investment platform Groww, said it’s seeking for its initial public offering in Mumbai to raise as much as 66.3 billion rupees ($752 million).】

item.title: 印尼债券有望在降息预期下延续涨势
item.description: 策略师认为，印尼债券还有进一步反弹的空间，因为人们预期印尼央行将进一步降息。【原文：Indonesian bonds have room to rally further, according to strategists, on expectations of further interest-rate cuts by the central bank.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行在美国命令下推行新的非法金融规则
item.description: 墨西哥银行业游说团体建议其成员超越现行法规，打击非法融资，因为美国打击了该国一些涉嫌帮助毒贩的银行。【原文：Mexico’s banking lobby is recommending its members go beyond current regulations to fight illicit financing after the US cracked down on some banks in the country for allegedly aiding drug traffickers.】

item.title: 人工智能推动内存需求增长，三星芯片利润飙升
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.）的半导体部门报告的利润增长强于预期，表明全球人工智能需求正在帮助推动这家韩国公司最重要业务的复苏。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co.’s semiconductor arm reported a stronger-than-expected rise in profit, suggesting global AI demand is helping drive a recovery at the Korean company’s most important business.】

item.title: 新加坡前部长林德福据说即将卸任全国职工总会主席一职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡前部长林文兴准备从职总企业合作社有限公司（收入保险有限公司的母公司）主席的职位上退休。【原文：Singapore former minister Lim Boon Heng is poised to retire from his role as chairman of NTUC Enterprise Co-operative Ltd., the parent of Income Insurance Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国监管机构提出注销 5 亿英镑能源债务的计划
item.description: 英国能源监管机构建议，通过核销高达 5 亿英镑（6.59 亿美元）的未付账单，并将这些费用分摊给所有消费者，来解决该国庞大的家庭能源债务问题。【原文：The UK energy regulator proposes tackling the country’s massive household energy debt by writing off as much as £500 million ($659 million) in unpaid bills and spreading those costs across all consumers.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将在年底预测前按兵不动：决策指南
item.description: 欧洲中央银行将在第三次会议上维持利率不变，等待年终预测进一步明确贸易紧张局势和法国财政危机造成的损害。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to keep interest rates unchanged for a third meeting, awaiting year-end projections that will offer greater clarity on harm caused by trade tensions and France’s fiscal crisis.】

item.title: 货币反弹、经济增长有望带来越南股票外流缓解
item.description: 在越南货币重新走强和估值降低的帮助下，外资流出越南股市的情况正在缓解。【原文：Foreign outflows from Vietnam stocks are easing, helped by renewed strength in the country’s currency and lower valuations.】

item.title: 简街在印度的困境促使高频公司改变策略
item.description: 去年 11 月，印度监管机构开始全面打击衍生品市场，并对 Jane Street Group 展开调查，此后，印度的交易公司正在放弃高频期权策略，重新编写自己的游戏规则。【原文：India’s trading firms are shifting away from high-frequency options strategies, rewriting their playbooks after the country’s regulator began a sweeping crackdown on the derivatives market last November and opened an investigation into Jane Street Group.】

item.title: 路透社称，OpenAI IPO 目标估值或达 1 万亿美元
item.description: 据路透社周三援引未具名消息人士的话报道，人工智能初创公司OpenAI正准备申请首次公开募股，最快将于明年上市，这将使该公司的市值达到1万亿美元。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup OpenAI is preparing to file for an initial public offering as soon as next year that could give the company a market capitalization of $1 trillion, Reuters reported Wednesday, citing unidentified sources.】

item.title: 美联储主席浇灭 12 月降息希望，黄金低迷态势持续
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）淡化了 12 月降息的可能性后，交易员们缩减了对美联储进一步宽松政策的押注。【原文：Gold edged higher after four days of losses, with traders scaling back bets on more Federal Reserve easing after Chair Jerome Powell downplayed the likelihood of a December interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 交易商关注中美峰会和欧佩克+会议，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 随着交易员们对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普与中国总统习近平之间的峰会以及之后的欧佩克+供应会议进行倒计时，石油价格趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as traders counted down to a summit between US President Donald Trump and Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping and, beyond that, an OPEC+ meeting on supply.】

item.title: 盈利疑云笼罩，比亚迪股价将迎来第五个月亏损
item.description: 比亚迪股份有限公司在香港上市的股票正走向2018年以来最长的月度连跌，因为投资者对该公司抵御中国市场竞争的能力越来越怀疑。【原文：BYD Co.’s Hong Kong-listed shares are heading for their longest streak of monthly declines since 2018 as investors grow increasingly skeptical about the company’s ability to fend off competition in China.】

item.title: 鲍威尔 12 月警告暴露美联储分歧加剧
item.description: 美联储主席鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）直言不讳地警告说，投资者需要控制对12月降息的预期，这凸显了美国政策制定者之间日益激烈的角力，他们对就业和通胀的展望截然相反。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s blunt warning that investors need to rein in expectations for a December interest-rate cut underscored a growing tug-of-war among US policymakers who are opposed in their outlooks for jobs and inflation.】

item.title: 鲍威尔谨慎降息后亚洲涨势将停滞：市场综述
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔警告说，今年再次降息并非板上钉钉的事，美国股市受此影响，亚洲股市的涨势将陷入停滞。【原文：Asia’s stock rally is set to stall after US equities whipsawed as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell cautioned another cut this year isn’t a foregone conclusion.】

item.title: 参议院反驳特朗普对加拿大征收关税，美国共和党在贸易问题上出现分歧
item.description: 共和党控制的参议院以微弱优势通过了结束唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大征收关税的法案，这凸显了共和党在关税问题上的分歧，而就在几天前，总统还威胁要进一步增加关税以惩罚美国的北方邻国。【原文：The Republican-controlled Senate narrowly passed a bill to end Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canada, highlighting GOP divisions over the duties just days after the president threatened to increase them further to punish the US’s northern neighbor.】

item.title: 中国金融企业的盈利增长将超过整个市场
item.description: 自 8 月份以来，中国银行和保险公司的盈利预测稳步攀升，中国金融业的盈利增长有望超过大盘。【原文：China’s financial sector is on track to outpace the broader market’s earnings growth, with forecasts for the nation’s banks and insurance firms climbing steadily since August.】

哈维开发的生成式人工智能产品旨在实现法律工作的自动化。【原文：

item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）、花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Bank of America Corp., Citigroup Inc. and Morgan Stanley are among about 20 banks that have joined a $20 billion debt financing backing the buyout of Electronic Arts Inc., giving them a slice of the massive fees tied to the biggest leveraged buyout ever.】

item.title: 辛鲍姆和在美国阴影下成长的挑战
item.description:
墨西哥面临着一个经济转折点：减少对美国的依赖，吸引投资，在不确定的环境中保持财政稳定。【原文：

México enfrenta un punto de inflexión económico: depender menos de EE.UU., atraer inversión y mantener la estabilidad fiscal bajo un entorno incierto.

item.title: 让墨西哥比美国发展得更快的机会来了
item.description:
国家正处于十字路口，墨西哥总统的决策将决定经济增长是一飞冲天，还是陷入停滞。【原文：

With the nation at a crossroads, the Mexican president’s decisions will determine whether growth takes off — or becomes mired in stagnation.

item.title: OpenAI 正在创建一家公益公司。这意味着什么？
item.description: 经过数月与监管机构和利益相关者的反复沟通，OpenAI 表示已完成重组，成为一家更传统的营利性公司，这是该公司争取获得数十亿美元资金以打造尖端人工智能产品的关键一步。【原文：After months of back-and-forth with regulators and stakeholders, OpenAI said it has completed the process of restructuring as a more traditional, for-profit company – a key step in its bid to secure billions more in capital to build cutting-edge artificial intelligence products.】

item.title: 克利夫兰-克利夫公司寻求通过出售股票筹资 9.825 亿美元
item.description: 克利夫兰-克利夫斯公司（Cleveland-Cliffs Inc.【原文：Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $982.5 million in a share sale, as the steel and iron-ore pellet producer seeks to pay down debt.】

item.title: ServiceNow 销售额增长强劲，称人工智能有助于削减开支
item.description: ServiceNow 公司展望了强劲的收入增长，并表示人工智能正在帮助公司降低成本。【原文：ServiceNow Inc. gave an outlook for strong revenue growth and said AI is helping the company reduce costs.】

item.title: Meta 计划增加支出，一次性收取税费
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司表示，预计 2026 年的总支出将大幅增加，该公司在数据中心和其他设备上的支出将继续保持历史水平，以推动其在人工智能领域的努力。股价在延时交易中下跌。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. said it expects total expenses to significantly increase in 2026, and the company will continue to spend at historic levels on data centers and other equipment to fuel its effort in artificial intelligence. The shares dropped in extended trading.】

item.title: EBay 公布假日期间盈利前景不佳，股价下跌
item.description: EBay Inc. 公布的第四季度利润预期低于分析师的平均预期，这加剧了投资者对进入假日购物季后利润收窄的担忧。【原文：EBay Inc. gave a profit forecast for the fourth quarter that missed the average analyst estimate, stoking investor concerns about narrowing margins heading into the holiday shopping season.】

item.title: 前档案代理在埃德加数据内幕案中认罪
item.description: 布鲁克林一名男子承认利用客户机密信息进行交易，非法获利 220 多万美元。【原文：A Brooklyn man who worked for a private business that provides services for companies filing to the Securities and Exchange Commission’s Edgar system, pleaded guilty to using confidential client information to make trades that led to more than $2.2 million in illicit profits.】
